> Testcase: testOpenCloseDb(tierra.dbutils.DbAccessTest): Caused an
> ERROR javax/resource/ResourceException
> java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/resource/ResourceException

...

> What I don't understand is: why does JUnit catch the exception that
> has already been caught? Why doesn't my process just continue?

Take a closer look: your code doesn't throw a ClassNotFoundException, but a
NoClassDefFoundError. This typically happens when the class specified in
Class.forName does exist, but cannot be loaded because a required other
class cannot be loaded. Whatever driver you try to register after
PostgresSQL seems to be missing something in the classpath, namely the
ResourceException class.

Hope this helps,

Ilja
